trans-unit.source: More about Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions
trans-unit.target: More about Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions

trans-unit.source: Custom settings description of Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions.
trans-unit.target: Custom settings description of Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions.

trans-unit.source: More about Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions
trans-unit.target: More about Azure AD Connect credentials and permissions

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect wizard offers two different paths with distinct permissions requirements:
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect wizard offers two different paths with distinct permissions requirements:

trans-unit.source: In Express Settings, we require more privileges so that we can setup your configuration easily, without requiring you to create users or configure permissions separately.
trans-unit.target: In Express Settings, we require more privileges so that we can setup your configuration easily, without requiring you to create users or configure permissions separately.

trans-unit.source: In Custom Settings we offer you more choices and options, but there are some situations in which you’ll need to ensure you have the correct permissions yourself.
trans-unit.target: In Custom Settings we offer you more choices and options, but there are some situations in which you’ll need to ensure you have the correct permissions yourself.

trans-unit.source: Credentials that are collected and what they are used for in an Express setup
trans-unit.target: Credentials that are collected and what they are used for in an Express setup

trans-unit.target: Global administrator role in Azure AD

trans-unit.target: <html></html>Enabling sync in the Azure AD directory.<html></html> <html></html>Creation of the Azure AD account that will be used for on-going sync operations in Azure AD.<html></html>

trans-unit.target: Member of the Enterprise Admins (EA) group in Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Used as the local AD Connector account, that is, it is the account that reads and writes the directory information for synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Used as the local AD Connector account, that is, it is the account that reads and writes the directory information for synchronization.

trans-unit.source: <html></html>By default, wizard creates the AD account that will be used as the sync service logon account on the local machine<html></html><html></html>We only create the sync service logon account if the admin does not specify a particular account<html></html> <html></html>The account is a local user unless on a DC in which case the account is a domain user<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>By default, wizard creates the AD account that will be used as the sync service logon account on the local machine<html></html><html></html>We only create the sync service logon account if the admin does not specify a particular account<html></html> <html></html>The account is a local user unless on a DC in which case the account is a domain user<html></html>

trans-unit.target: Install synchronization services page, Service account option

trans-unit.source: AD or local user account credentials
trans-unit.target: AD or local user account credentials

trans-unit.source: If the admin specifies an account, this account is used as the logon account for the sync service.
trans-unit.target: If the admin specifies an account, this account is used as the logon account for the sync service.

trans-unit.source: Global administrator role in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Global administrator role in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: The wizard creates the AD account that will be used as the sync service logon account on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: The wizard creates the AD account that will be used as the sync service logon account on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: On premises Active Directory credentials for each forest that will be connected to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: On premises Active Directory credentials for each forest that will be connected to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: <html></html>The minimum level of permissions required by the wizard is Domain user.<html></html> <html></html>However, the specified account must have the permissions required for your intended scenario.<html></html><html></html>If you intend to configure password sync to Azure AD, ensure this account has the following permissions assigned: -Replicating Directory Changes -Replicating Directory Changes All<html></html> <html></html>If you intend to configure sync to ‘write back’ information from Azure AD to your local AD, ensure the account has write permissions to the directory objects and attributes you intend to be written back.<html></html> <html></html>If you intend to configure AD FS for Sign on, ensure the AD credentials you provide for the forest in which your AD FS servers reside has Domain Administrator privileges.<html></html><html></html>See the table below of a list of additional requirements for your scenario.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>The minimum level of permissions required by the wizard is Domain user.<html></html> <html></html>However, the specified account must have the permissions required for your intended scenario.<html></html><html></html>If you intend to configure password sync to Azure AD, ensure this account has the following permissions assigned: -Replicating Directory Changes -Replicating Directory Changes All<html></html> <html></html>If you intend to configure sync to ‘write back’ information from Azure AD to your local AD, ensure the account has write permissions to the directory objects and attributes you intend to be written back.<html></html> <html></html>If you intend to configure AD FS for Sign on, ensure the AD credentials you provide for the forest in which your AD FS servers reside has Domain Administrator privileges.<html></html><html></html>See the table below of a list of additional requirements for your scenario.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: <html></html>This is the account that will be used for the local AD Management Agent (MA) account.It will be used for reading and writing objects and attributes in the local AD for ongoing sync operation.<html></html><html></html>Assigning the correct permissions and access control settings for your chosen sync options to the above account and to AD.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html>This is the account that will be used for the local AD Management Agent (MA) account.It will be used for reading and writing objects and attributes in the local AD for ongoing sync operation.<html></html><html></html>Assigning the correct permissions and access control settings for your chosen sync options to the above account and to AD.<html></html>
